org.gbif.registry.metasync.protocols.biocase

Class BiocaseMetadataSynchroniser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.registry.metasync.protocols.BaseProtocolHandler
      • org.gbif.registry.metasync.protocols.biocase.BiocaseMetadataSynchroniser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MetadataProtocolHandler

    public class BiocaseMetadataSynchroniser
extends BaseProtocolHandler
    Synchronises metadata from a BioCASe Installation.

    Every BioCASe Installation can have multiple Endpoints, each of those Endpoints can have multiple Datasets and each of those Datasets can have multiple Endpoints (Web service, ABCD Archive, DwC-A).

    BioCASe synchronisation happens in the following steps:

    • For all endpoints of an Installation make a capabilities request, followed by a dataset inventory request, then a metadata and count (to get the number of records) request for each dataset
    • The type of inventory request depends on the capabilities. Newer version of BioCASe (3.4 and greater) support a separate inventory request.

    Unfortunately BioCASe does not have good (stable) identifiers for Datasets so we need to rely on the Dataset title.

      • canHandle

        public boolean canHandle(org.gbif.api.model.registry.Installation installation)
        Description copied from interface: MetadataProtocolHandler
        Determines if this handler does support the Installation in question. If it returns true then MetadataProtocolHandler.syncInstallation(Installation, List) installation will be called with the Installation.
